definition: to call to come and shout to go (idiom); to yell orders/always bossing people around
to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale
variant of 呼[hu1]/to shout/to call out
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
to drink/variant of 嗬[he1]
to shout

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: She likes to boss her kids around.
sentences.chinese: 她喜欢把她的孩子们呼来喝去。

sentences.english: The boss is always ordering us around.
sentences.chinese: 老板对我们总是呼来喝去的。

sentences.english: He's always bossing his wife around.
sentences.chinese: 他对妻子总是呼来喝去的。

definition: lit. to order people by pointing the chin (idiom); to signal orders by facial gesture/arrogant and bossy
lit. to shout out hoping for fives and sixes when gambling with dice; a hubbub of gambling
to order sb about/to use sb
to follow obediently
to order (sb) around/to send on an errand/to order away
to pick on sth incessantly (idiom)/to criticize right and left
pinyin: heng2 tiao1 bi2 zi5 shu4 tiao1 yan3

definition: bowed head and ears glued (idiom); docile and obedient/at sb's beck and call
to gesticulate while talking (idiom)/to explain by waving one's hands/to criticize or give orders summarily
to come when called (idiom); ready and compliant/always at sb's beck and call
pinyin: hu1 zhi1 ji2 lai2 , hui1 zhi1 ji2 qu4

definition: to gesticulate while talking (idiom); to explain by waving one's hands/to criticize or give orders summarily/also written 指手畫腳|指手画脚
sarcastic comments (idiom)/to make sarcastic comments
tyrannical abuse (idiom); riding roughshod over people
to grimace with displeasure/to pull a long face
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to put on airs/to assume great airs
to bow and bend the knee (idiom); fawning/bending and scraping to curry favor
